page.title: 06THE HAMLET OF KERSOE
page.content: This was known in the Saxon as {Criddesho}(780 AD) and is situated on the South Eastern slopes of Bredon Hill. It consists of 32 dwellings ranging from Elizabethan to Victorian with one, post second world war house. Kersoe Farm of 800 acres, is mainly concerned with cereal growing but also has sheep and beef cattle. Middle Farm has 9 acres of grassland and Manor Farm Stables 19 acres divided between grass and market garden. Twenty years ago the population numbered 40, mostly in agricultural employment, but with the changes of demand for workers on the land despite the population numbers being almost the same, most newcomers are of the professional type, with cars and many of the modern conveniences. Only eight can now be found working on the land.
